TypeSignature.Value: .class public sequential ansi sealed beforefieldinit ReadOnlySpan`1<T> extends System.ValueType
generic <typename T> public value class ReadOnlySpan

Docs.typeparam: The type of items in the .
Docs.summary: Provides a type-safe and memory-safe read-only representation of a contiguous region of arbitrary memory.

remarks.format:
`ReadOnlySpan<T>` is a [ref struct](~/docs/csharp/language-reference/keywords/ref.md#ref-struct-types) that is allocated on the stack and can never escape to the managed heap. Ref struct types have a number of restrictions to ensure that they cannot be promoted to the managed heap, including that they can't be boxed, captured in lambda expressions, assigned to variables of type <xref:System.Object>, assigned to `dynamic` variables, and they cannot implement any interface type.
A `ReadOnlySpan<T>` instance is often used to reference the elements of an array or a portion of an array. Unlike an array, however, a `ReadOnlySpan<T>` instance can point to managed memory, native memory, or memory managed on the stack.

remarks.format: If the array is null, this constructor returns a null `ReadOnlySpan<T>`.

Docs.summary: Creates a new from a specified number of elements starting at a specified memory address.

remarks.format: This constructor should be used with care, since it creates arbitrarily typed `T`s from a block of memory.

Docs.exception: is a reference type or contains references and therefore cannot be stored in unmanaged memory.

remarks.format: This tests if two <xref:System.ReadOnlySpan`1> instances point to the same starting memory location, and have the same <xref:System.ReadOnlySpan`1.Length> values. This does not compare the contents of two <xref:System.ReadOnlySpan`1> instances.

remarks.format: Two <xref:System.ReadOnlySpan%601> instances are not equal if they have different lengths or if the corresponding elements of `left` and `right` point to different memory locations.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance !T[] ToArray() cil managed

Docs.summary: Copies the contents of this read-only span into a new array.
Docs.returns: An array containing the data in the current span.

remarks.format: This method performs a heap allocation and data copy, and therefore, should be avoided if possible. It it sometimes necessary when APIs that support <xref:System.ReadOnlySpan%601> are not available, but APIs that work with arrays are.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance string ToString() cil managed
Public Overrides Function ToString () As String

Docs.summary: Returns the string representation of this .
Docs.returns: The string representation of this instance.

remarks.format: For a `ReadOnlySpan<Char>`, the `ToString` method returns a <xref:System.String> that contains the characters pointed to by the span. Otherwise, it returns a <xref:System.String> with the name of the type and the number of elements that the span contains.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool TryCopyTo(valuetype System.Span`1<!T> destination) cil managed
Public Function TryCopyTo (destination As Span(Of T)) As Boolean

Docs.param: The target of the copy operation.
Docs.summary: Attempts to copy the contents of this into a and returns a value to indicate whether or not the operation succeeded.
Docs.returns: if the copy operation succeeded; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
If the `source` and `destination` overlap, the entirety of `source` is handled as if it was copied to a temporary location before it is copied to `destination`.
If the `destination` length is shorter than `source`, no items are copied and the method returns `false`.
